Corpus: Griffith Corpus of Spoken Australian English
Description: This corpus is available for download and through the concordancer of the Australian National Corpus.
This corpus contains face-to-face conversations between people who speak British English as their first language.#SEPThe corpus is available through the CQP concordancer.

Corpus: The Aston Corpus of West Midlands English (ACWME)
Description: This corpus contains recordings of performances - comedy, drama, poetry, song and story-telling - and related interviews with performers, members of the audience and local and national celebrities.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from a dedicated webpage.
This corpus contains naturally occurring, non-scripted face-to-face interactions in English as a lingua franca (ELF).#SEPThe corpus is available through a dedicated concordancer.
This corpus contains TV-broadcasts and elicited dialogues.
This corpus contains various elicited speech tasks.
This corpus is available for download (upon request) from META-SHARE.
This corpus contains radio broadcasts (reading aloud and spontaneous conversation)#SEPThe corpus is available through the Hungarian Gigaword Corpus concordancer.
This corpus contains elicited speech tasks (picture descriptions) and guided conversation with children.#SEPThe corpus is available for download through META-SHARE.
This corpus contains reading tasks.#SEPThe corpus is available for download (upon request) from META-SHARE.
This corpus is available for download (upon request) from META-SHARE.
This corpus is available through a dedicated concordancer.
This corpus contains quasi-spontaneous dialogues (a map task).#SEPThe corpus is available for download from a dedicated webpage.
This is a L2-learner corpus.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from a dedicated webpage.

Corpus: Uralic Languages under the Influence (UraLUID) database
Annotation: MSD-tagged, time-alignment, phonetic and orthographic transcription
Language: Udmurt, Tundra Nenets, Synya Khanty, Surgut Khanty
Description: This corpus contains narratives (e.g., folk storites).#SEPThe corpus is available for download from a dedicated website.
